summary: Design and build a modern premium marketing website for heritage signage company Gujrati Signage (est. 1960) emphasizing legacy and trust, with a simplified static first-page/hero (no motion graphics), clear logo presence, prominent credibility stats, expanded products offering, and lead capture/order enquiry flows.
architectural_notes: Use 3D elements with subtle lighting, reflections, and soft shadows; avoid flashy effects to maintain calm luxury feel.
Plan for SEO-friendly semantic structure and performance-focused animation approach (smooth scrolling, micro-interactions).
First page/hero should be static/minimal (no motion graphics) while preserving a premium look; prioritize clear logo visibility and readability.
Hero/first page should have a plain background; use white+purple gradient text styling; remove centered “Gujrati signage” from the hero.
Remove the “1,000,000+ projects completed” credibility stat from the first page/hero (can remain elsewhere if needed).
Add an “About the Founders” section with provided narrative + founder quotes, matching the premium minimal layout.
Apply white-to-purple gradient styling consistently to all headings across the site.
Replace golden/metallic wordmark styling: “Gujrati signage” should be plain white with a premium font, clearly visible on all backgrounds.
known_issues: Logo image is not visible in the current build; user requested removing it and using golden text instead.
Contact email appears incorrect/typo in current build; should be vikrantpatel77.vp@gmail.com.

existing_features.title: Create a modern, premium, minimal, fully responsive marketing website for “Gujrati Signage” (established 1960) that communicates legacy, craftsmanship, trust, and innovation using a black/white/metallic-silver/soft-neutral palette with subtle accent highlights, sophisticated typography, and balanced white space.

Implement the requested single-page website structure with cinematic section transitions/parallax and smooth micro-animations: Hero, About Us, Our Services (3D cards), Work Showcase/Gallery, Why Choose Us, and Contact.

Build the Hero section with headline “Crafting Signage Excellence Since 1960”, a subtle animated 3D signage/light-board element, a smooth scroll cue, and two clear CTAs: “Contact Us” and “View Our Work”.

Add an intro interaction at the start of the site: a phone UI pops up and a Bitmoji-like (cartoon) “Vikrant Patel” helper character appears and asks: “How can I help you?” with options to proceed (e.g., Contact, Services, View Work) while allowing the user to dismiss/skip the intro.
Implement the About Us section with a brand story emphasizing establishment in 1960, experience, precision, and long-term trust, using elegant text animations and a clean layout.

Implement “Our Services” as premium interactive 3D service cards with smooth hover/tap interactions for: Building Signages, Name Plates, Number Plates, Light Boards, Custom Sign Boards, Radium Stickers.
Create a Work Showcase / Gallery section with high-quality visuals (provided/generated), smooth transitions, and immersive scrolling behavior consistent with the premium look.
Implement a “Why Choose Us” section listing: Over 60 years of expertise, Custom-built solutions, Quality materials & craftsmanship, Trusted by generations; use minimal icons with subtle animations.

Build the Contact section with a clean, elegant layout that clearly shows contact details and provides click-to-call buttons and social links with refined hover effects. Include: Phone: 9828939660, 9828054199; Email: vikratpatell77.vp@gmail.com; Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/gujratisignage_; Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/share/1HjagdkEXW/
Add SEO-friendly structure for a marketing site: semantic sectioning, sensible heading hierarchy, descriptive page title/description, and accessible image alt text.

Use the user-provided uploaded image (WhatsApp Image 2026-02-09 at 14.40.31.jpeg) as a brand/logo asset in the site (e.g., header and/or hero) and ensure it is displayed crisply on light/dark backgrounds.

Add and render generated static images aligned to the premium 3D aesthetic for the hero, services, and gallery; store them as static assets and use them in the relevant sections without routing through the backend.
Remove motion graphics/animations from the first page (Hero) so it is plain and static, while keeping the premium minimal layout.
Add the company logo prominently on the first page (Hero) and ensure the header logo uses the updated company logo asset.
Add a prominent credibility metric on the site: display “1,000,000+ projects completed” as a key stat (including updating any existing 'Projects Completed' stat).
Add a new “Products” section to the landing page and include product entries for: hospital boards, reception boards, steel letters, neon signs, glow sign board.
Add Vision and Mission content to the site using the exact user-provided text (English), formatted as a clear section (or subsections) on the landing page.
Add an enquiry flow: provide an enquiry form that lets customers submit requirements (name, phone, email optional, message/requirements) and shows a success confirmation after submission.

Add an “order from website” request flow: allow customers to place an order/request by selecting a product and entering order details (name, phone, product, quantity/size optional, notes), then persist it in the backend.

Remove the logo image from the marketing site UI and replace it with a text wordmark that reads exactly “Gujrati signage” styled in a premium golden/metallic look, ensuring it is clearly visible on all backgrounds in the header, hero, and footer.

Ensure the Products list and Products section display all requested product entries in English: “Hospital Boards”, “Reception Boards”, “Steel Letters”, “Neon Signs”, and “Glow Sign Boards”, and that ordering preselection continues to work for each product card.

Add a new "Payment" section to the marketing landing page and include it in the header navigation.

The section must:
- Be reachable via an in-page anchor id="payment" and a new "Payment" nav link.
- Present payment as an informational/CTA section (no real payment processing) with clear English headings and a primary action that routes the user to an existing contact/enquiry/order section (smooth-scroll).
- Match the existing premium minimal styling and responsive layout patterns used by other sections.

Update the Hero (first page) to remove the centered "Gujrati signage" wordmark and remove the "1,000,000+ Projects Completed" stat from the Hero.

Also update the Hero background to be plain (solid) rather than using the current background image and background gradient.
Change the Hero gradient text styling to use a white-to-purple gradient (instead of the current metallic gradient) for the Hero’s gradient-highlighted text (e.g., the "Since 1960" highlighted line).

Add a new marketing landing-page section titled “The Founders” that presents the user-provided founders/legacy/journey/quotes content in English, with a premium minimal layout consistent with existing sections, and include it in the landing page flow and header navigation via an in-page anchor.
Update site-wide marketing heading styling so all headings use a white-to-purple gradient, replacing the current metallic gradient heading treatment wherever it appears.

Update the site wordmark text “Gujrati signage” to use a plain white, premium font treatment (remove the current golden/metallic gradient styling) and ensure it remains clearly readable in the header and footer across light/dark backgrounds and scrolled/unscrolled header states.
Update the displayed contact email address and mailto link everywhere it appears on the marketing site to exactly: vikrantpatel77.vp@gmail.com.

Extend the Services section to include image-based service cards for the following entries (English names exactly as written): “Hospital Boards”, “Reception Boards”, “Steel Letters”, “Neon Signs”, and “Glow Sign Boards”. Each new service card must include an image and a short English description consistent with the existing premium services card layout and interactions.

Add desktop header navigation hover behavior so that when the mouse hovers over a top navigation item (e.g., Home, About, Services, Products, etc.), a small premium-styled hover panel/tooltip appears showing brief section details (1–2 lines) for that nav item; keep mobile navigation behavior unchanged.
